<h1 id="postcss-selector-parser-%21build-status">postcss-selector-parser <a href="https://travis-ci.org/postcss/postcss-selector-parser"><img src="https://travis-ci.org/postcss/postcss-selector-parser.svg?branch=master" alt="Build Status" /></a></h1>

<blockquote>
  <p>Selector parser with built in methods for working with selector strings.</p>
</blockquote>

<h2 id="install">Install</h2>

<p>With <a href="https://npmjs.com/package/postcss-selector-parser">npm</a> do:</p>

<pre><code>npm install postcss-selector-parser
</code></pre>

<h2 id="quick-start">Quick Start</h2>

<pre><code class="js">var parser = require('postcss-selector-parser');
var transform = function (selectors) {
    selectors.eachInside(function (selector) {
        // do something with the selector
        console.log(String(selector))
    });
};

var transformed = parser(transform).process('h1, h2, h3').result;
</code></pre>

<p>To normalize selector whitespace:</p>

<pre><code class="js">var parser = require('postcss-selector-parser');
var normalized = parser().process('h1, h2, h3', {lossless:false}).result;
// -&gt; h1,h2,h3
</code></pre>

<h2 id="api">API</h2>

<p>Please see <a href="API.md">API.md</a>.</p>
